description: After the installation of the security updates identified in KB5037768 and KB5037770, users may experience unexpected behavior wherein certain privileges are elevated inadvertently within the Windows Search Service. This could manifest as sensitive configurations being accessed or modified without proper authorization, leading to potential breaches of security protocols. These updates, applicable to several versions of Windows 10 and Windows 11, including build numbers 10.0.19045.4412 and 10.0.22000.2960, highlight important security enhancements aimed at mitigating such risks. Administrators should remain vigilant for signs of unauthorized access or altered settings in their system logs following patch application. It's crucial to ensure that all systems are running these updates to prevent exploitation of this behavior.
